What human being on any side of the political spectrum would suggest that they want somebody else to control their lives? What a buffoonish statement. You sound like a complete fool when you regurgitate the same gibberish over and over again. And trying to suggest that the President is trying to turn America into Cuba, N. Korea etc. is comically absurd. Crackpots like you and Rush, Beck and Coulter have tried to commandeer the term “liberal” and convert it into another bogie-man scare tactic that they can make millions off of while selling fear, bigotry and intolerance to apolitical dunces Being liberal in no way suggests that “big” government can “solve all our problems and control our lives.” Folks like you and Ann Coulter seem to have this fixation that “size matters”, in government as well as your personal lives. Instead of trying to change the meaning of the word, why don’t you tell us all what problems you have with this?: “Liberalism first became a distinct political movement during the Age of Enlightenment, when it became popular among philosophers and economists in the Western world. Liberalism rejected the notions, common at the time, of hereditary privilege, state religion, absolute monarchy, and the Divine Right of Kings.” Definition: “A political or social philosophy advocating the freedom of the individual, parliamentary systems of government, nonviolent modification of political, social, or economic institutions to assure unrestricted development in all spheres of human endeavor, and governmental guarantees of individual rights and civil liberties.” Social liberalism goes a step further: …”the belief that liberalism should include social justice and that the legitimate role of the state includes addressing issues such as unemployment, health care, education, and the expansion of civil rights.” What part of that scares you so much, winbag...expanding civil rights and helping people get educated? Intelligent people understand that we live in an imperfect world and that there is a legitimate role for government to play in providing access to an equal chance for life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness for EVERYONE, not just those of a certain class, socio-economic status or members of the oligarchy through birthright or inheritance. Your problem is that in trying to protect the status quo of the good old boy network of the 2%, you attempt to malign everyone else, as Romney did with his 47% comments. Throwing out your repeated clichés under multiple aliases reveals your true intentions. Not even knowing the definition of liberalism indicates even more about your character, intelligence and ethics or lack thereof.
